p: At the current time, no extensive exploration of flavaglines toxicity has been disclosed. Yet, at doses where they exert potent cardioprotectant and anti-inflammatory effects, flavaglines did not exhibit any overt sign of toxicity [ 2, 5]. In addition a synthetic flavagline developed by the eFFECTOR Therapeutics company, Zotatifin (also called eFT226, 4, Fig.Â 1) has passed the US regulatory toxicology requirements necessary to enter a phase 1/2 clinical trial against advanced solid tumors refractory or intolerant to standard treatments [ 19, 20]. While it was shown to inhibit eIF4A, its putative effect on PHB signaling has not yet been disclosed.
